Classical.Structure: Nucleus of the Solitary Tract (Nucleus Tractus Solitarii). A nucleus in the brainstem.
Classical.Function: Primary integration center for visceral afferent information. Receives signals from the vagus nerve (taste, gut, heart, lungs) and relays them to higher brain centers (e.g., hypothalamus, insula).

SCPN.L2_NeurochemicalNeurological: The first central processing 'node' for vagal afferents. Integrates and filters raw bodily signals.
SCPN.L4_CellularTissueSynchronisation: Formalizes tissue-level dynamics via phase-coupled oscillators, quasicritical operation (Griffiths regimes), and multi-path coupling (gap junctions, ephaptic fields, glial/vascular slow control). Models entrainment to cosmological rhythms (Schumann, lunar) via biophotons and cryptochromes.
SCPN.L5_OrganismalPsychoemotional: The primary input port for the Insula. It aggregates the body's 'raw data' before the Insula translates it into 'conscious feeling' (qualia).

Symbolic.MetaphysicalMapping: The 'root' gateway where signals from the 'Earth' (the body, via the vagus 'World Tree') first enter the 'Heavens' (the brain/conscious mind).

Falsification_Hypotheses: Severing the vagus nerve (vagotomy) will have no effect on NTS activity.
NTS neurons will not respond to changes in blood pressure or taste stimuli.
Experimental_Protocols: In-vivo recording from NTS neurons while stimulating the vagus nerve.
cFos mapping in the NTS following induced hypertension.
Simulation_Suite: Model the NTS as an integration-and-fire network for processing vagal inputs.
